name: Canada
notes: Points-based Express Entry system. High demand for tech workers. Clear path to PR and citizenship.

visa_types.name: Express Entry (Federal Skilled Worker)
visa_types.description: Points-based immigration system for skilled workers. Primary pathway for tech professionals.
requirements: At least 1 year continuous skilled work experience
Proof of funds (unless you have valid job offer)
tips: IELTS 8+ band significantly boosts CRS score

visa_types.name: Provincial Nominee Program
visa_types.description: Province-specific immigration programs. Can add 600 CRS points to Express Entry.
requirements: Intent to reside in nominating province
tips: Ontario and BC have tech-specific streams
Some provinces have no minimum CRS requirement

visa_types.name: Employer-Sponsored Work Permit (LMIA)
visa_types.description: Work permit requiring Canadian job offer with Labour Market Impact Assessment.
requirements: Valid job offer from Canadian employer
visa_types.path_to_pr: Can apply for Express Entry after 1 year Canadian experience
tips: Global Talent Stream has faster processing

visa_types.name: Study Permit (Student Visa)
visa_types.description: Permit for international students. Popular pathway to PR through PGWP.
requirements: Proof of funds for tuition and living
visa_types.work_hours_limit: 20 hours/week during studies, full-time during breaks
visa_types.spouse_work_rights: Open work permit if student in Master's/PhD
tips: PGWP length equals study duration (max 3 years)
